feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: [S/4HANA Public Cloud] CDS Extraction to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am currently facing some issues with accessing the CDS Views from a S/4HANA Public Cloud to our SAP Datasphere system.

We have the connection up and running, everything validated for Data Flows & Replication Flows so we should be able to use these 2 objects to extract data to DSP.

The problem is when we are trying to add the object(CDS View in our case) from the source system under /CDS_EXTRACTION in S/4. Basically we have the source system, this folder and under CDS_EXTRACTION there's nothing. Our users are created with full privileges in both the systems so it shouldn't be an issue here..

We have read some other community blogs regarding some Authorization Group IDs that we need to configure in the Communication Arrangements to be able to extract CDS Views with no privilege limits, however we couldn't find any in our list.

Reference blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-architecture-blog-posts/s-4hana-public-cloud-integration-with-sap-datasphere/bc-p/14160538#M853

We went to CBC to create these Authorization Group IDs for SAP_DPS_ALL( I have understood that we should use this one), however we are not able to see this authorization in S/4 PC system in the arrangements.

 

Have you ever encountered this error? Is there anything that we might do wrong or a step that we are not doing in order to be able to extract CDS views from S/4 PC to SAP Datasphere? Anything would be very useful and greatly appreciated.

 

Last thing that I would like to mention is that we have 2 enviroments at this point (DEV & TEST) and we have configured the CBC on the one which has the system code like the DEV env (but I have understood that only 1 CBC is used for all systems, is that right?).

 

Best regards,

Florin

entry.title: Condition Types in Purchase Orders and Contracts (Header vs. Item Level
entry.content:
We are performing an internal evaluation regarding the configuration and use of condition types in SAP S/4HANA (Cloud, ULIC 2508) for purchase orders and purchase contracts. When creating (item-specific) purchasing conditions and purchase orders, other conditions often have to be included in addition to the pure price. These surcharges and discounts are valuation-relevant price components of the delivered goods or services. 

1. which condition types are to be used in SAP

2. define which of these are permitted at header level (e.g. general discounts) and which are only permitted at item level

3. customizing (hiding unwanted condition types) feasible?

entry.title: BADI for Warehouse Task to Sort HU
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

Following is the requirement or question for SAP EWM Public Cloud.

We have requirement to create Putaway Warehouse Task with logic Full first and partial quantity to be the last WT sequence.

Example:
HU1 Qty Partial : 80
HU2 Qty Full: 100
HU3 Qty Full: 100
HU4 Qty Full: 100

So we expect that system will sequence Warehouse Task creation as follow:
Sequence 1 for HU2 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 2 for HU3 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 3 for HU4 (Qty: 100)
Sequence 4 for HU1 (Qty: 80)

Can anybody share some BADI on Warehouse Task creation for SAP Public Cloud?
Or can we configure (standard) with the above requirement?

Thanks.

entry.title: 客户对S/4HANA Public Cloud的账套需求
entry.content: 客户的S/4HANA Public Cloud的账套需求如下： 0L（当地准则） +2L（奥地利会计准则当地合并报表）+4G（CNAP 中国会计准则恒天集团合并报表）在S系统里怎么实现？ 会计科目表：3种类型， （德国，奥地利，意大利，美国，中国，瑞士）6个本地的会计科目表+奥地利准则下的合并报表会计科目表+集团合并中国会计科目表用于4G 系统怎么实现？ 主分类账：0L 合并分类账： 2L （奥地利会计准则+合并科目表1） 合并分类账：4G （中国会计准则+中国会计科目表2） 公有云怎么实现配置？ 感谢。

entry.title: Is there a way to extract open accounting periods in public cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Dear Experts,

We are evaluating an interface to transfer sales data from an external system to SAP.
According to standard SAP behavior, I understand that when an accounting period is closed, posting a sales document (billing document) will result in a "Planned Posting" status.
This means the billing document can be created or updated, but it will not be posted to the general ledger (no accounting document is generated).

Problem Statement:
If a billing document cancellation is transmitted to SAP after the accounting period is closed, the billing document in SAP will be canceled.
Crucially:

  1. A canceled document cannot be "uncanceled" (reversal of cancellation is impossible).

  2. Even if a new credit memo ("Shin-Kuro Denpyo") is created, it will remain in an "Unposted" status.
    (This leads to inconsistent/incorrect data states).

Proposed Solution & Obstacle:
To prevent this, we intended to implement interface controls to block changes to billing documents after period closure.
However, our investigation revealed no standard API or CDS view to retrieve "Open" (unclosed) accounting periods in SAP Public Cloud ("Pabu Kura").
We therefore concluded that this control is currently infeasible via standard means.

Request:
Does SAP Public Cloud provide any method (e.g., API, CDS View, function module) to identify Open accounting periods?
If you have relevant information or implementation examples, we would greatly appreciate your guidance.

 

Please suggest.

Thank you very much.Best Regards!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Can We Bring “Import Financial Data” to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud? -Workflow Integration
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have implemented a Project Budget Approval Enhancement in SAP Public Cloud leveraging SAP BTP services. As part of this solution, we created the Import Financial Data app within SAP Work Zone to trigger the budget approval workflow. Once the workflow is triggered, the data is seamlessly transferred to the SAP Public Cloud.

We would like to know if there is a way to replicate the Import Financial Data app directly within SAP Public Cloud, since the current app is only available in SAP Work Zone.

entry.title: Looking for Released CDS View for Workcenter in "Pack Outbound Deliveries" App (F1624A)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are currently working on an integration requirement for the "Pack Outbound Deliveries" app (App ID: F1624A) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

As part of the solution, we need to retrieve the Workcenter (or Packing Station) information used during the packing process. However, we are unable to identify any released CDS View that exposes this data.

We have already explored the following views:

  • I_OutboundDelivery

  • I_OutboundDeliveryItem

  • I_EWM_WarehouseTask

  • I_EWM_WarehouseTask_2

    Unfortunately, none of them provide the Workcenter or Packing Station information.

Request:

Could anyone suggest if a released CDS view is available in S/4HANA Cloud that provides the Workcenter used during packing in this app?

If not, is there an alternative approach or extension point recommended to extract this information in a public cloud-compliant manner?

Use Case:

We need this data to integrate with a third-party label printing system (BarTender) where label routing depends on the Workcenter being used.

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

THanks & Regards

VK

entry.title: Missing Post Processing for Odata Inteface - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
I’m currently facing a challenge regarding interface design in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud environment.

My goal is to implement an interface that fulfills two key requirements:

  1. It must support post-processing and monitoring through the Application Interface Framework (AIF) in S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  2. It must provide an immediate response with clear error codes and messages, which can be forwarded to third-party systems.

    Unfortunately, I can’t achieve both at the same time with the current options. I’m forced to make a compromise:

    • With OData APIs, I do receive immediate error messages, which is ideal for integrating with third-party systems. However, OData interfaces do not support AIF, which means I lose important capabilities like system monitoring and post-processing.
    • On the other hand, asynchronous SOAP APIs are compatible with AIF and support post-processing and monitoring. But they don’t return immediate responses, making it hard to forward real-time errors to third-party systems.

      I’m working with business scenarios like Purchase Orders, Supplier Confirmations, Inbound Deliveries, and Supplier Invoices. Each of these either:

      • Offers OData APIs with no AIF support, or
      • Provides SOAP APIs, but only asynchronous ones without real-time feedback.

        At the moment, no matter which approach I choose—OData or SOAP—I seem to miss out on a crucial feature. Has anyone found a workaround or best practice to bridge this gap?

        Thank you!

        kind regards, 

        Philipp

entry.title: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Indicator "S" (Checks Issued) in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

We are currently facing a limitation in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud regarding the manual clearing of checks issued (Special G/L transactions with indicator "S").

Our process involves posting outgoing payments using Special G/L indicator “S” (Check/L/C). We are using payment method C, which has been configured to use "S" as the CME indicator.

However, when we attempt to clear these open items (e.g., via the app Post Outgoing Payments - F1612 or Clear Outgoing Payments - F1367), the system does not allow the selection of items with Special G/L indicator "S", and the CME field is not available for filtering or selection.

Request:

  • Could you confirm if there is a standard Fiori app or supported process in S/4HANA Public Cloud to manually clear Special G/L items with CME indicator “S” (e.g., issued checks)?

  • If not, is there an alternative or recommended approach to handle the manual clearing of these open items?

  • Is this functionality planned for future releases?

We appreciate your support and guidance on how to manage this process within Public Cloud.

Your faithfully,

Blas Roselló
